StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Studying Whole Genomes in the National Children's Study

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The data analyzed and reported in this manuscript were accessed from the database of Genotype and Phenotype (dbGaP) found at www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gap (Accession Number: phsXXXXXX). These data were obtained and analyses conducted as part of the National Children’s Study, supported by the Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development, and funded, through its appropriation, by the Office of the Director of the National Institutes of Health. These data were also obtained and analyses supported by NICHD Contracts No. HHSN275201100007C (University of California-Irvine Orange County), HHSN267200700021C (University of California San Diego, San Bernadino, Kern) and No. HHSN275200800015C (University of Washington – Grant County).
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: The use of the "Studying Whole Genomes in the National Children's Study" dataset requires local IRB approval. All requestors and data users must provide a local Institutional Review board [IRB] letter from their respective institution approving conduct of the proposed research project. Only full or expedited approvals will be accepted. The IRB letter must explicitly reference the use of the “Studying Whole Genomes in the National Children’s Study” dataset. The annual progress report should cite work done that relates specifically to this dataset [Studying Whole Genomes in the National Children’s Study] and not just a generic report for a series of datasets that may also have been requested at the same time.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
